intro: Campanula erinus f. albiflora, commonly known as the white campanula, is a flowering plant characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped white flowers. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is native to regions of Europe and Asia. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial, forming dense mats of foliage. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
